thread.title: Politics Live: Ahmed Fahour defends his Australia Post salary
thread.title_full: Politics Live: Ahmed Fahour defends his Australia Post salary

author: Stephanie Peatling
title: Politics Live: Ahmed Fahour defends his Australia Post salary
text:
Don't Play Bernardi's mischief making 
The former Liberal MP and now independent has welcomed Tony Abbott to join his party, after the former PM criticised the government. Live updates 8:56am 
Meanwhile, onwards and upwards to estimates committees. 
There's lots going on (although I can't promise a return of the discussion of Parliament House catering) but of most interest is the appearance of Ahmed Fahour . Australia Post chief executive Ahmed Fahour Photo: Luis Enrique Ascui 8:49am 
Today's tilt at relevance is offering a "warm welcoming embrace" to Tony Abbott should he wish to join Senator Bernardi's newly formed Australian Conservatives . 
Good luck with that. 8:45am 
Newly independent senator Cory Bernardi knows the caravan of coverage moves on all too quickly. 
Now that he is one of a group of independents he has to somehow inject himself into the story. 
Fortunately for him, ideas are not in short supply. 8:45am 
More committees, more mischief, more mayhem - situation normal. 8:42am 
Hello there and welcome to the day in politics . 
Andrew Meares , Alex Ellinghausen and I are here to take you through the day's events. 
It's a pleasure to have your company once again.
